explanation.overview: 这两个词都指'律师'，但在具体含义和使用上有所不同。

details.meaning: 泛指受过法律训练、有律师资格的人，通用术语
details.example: She's a lawyer specializing in corporate law.（她是专攻公司法的律师。）

details.meaning: 特指有资格代表客户出庭的律师，在美国更常用
details.example: You should consult an attorney before signing the contract.（签署合同前你应该咨询律师。）

life_examples.lawyer: I need to talk to my lawyer about this case.（我需要和我的律师讨论这个案子。）
life_examples.attorney: The district attorney will prosecute the case.（地方检察官将起诉此案。）

life_examples.lawyer: After law school, he became a lawyer.（法学院毕业后，他成为了一名律师。）
life_examples.attorney: She works as a defense attorney in Chicago.（她在芝加哥做辩护律师。）

common_errors.error: ❌ I need to hire an attorney to draft my will.（虽然不错，但非必须）
common_errors.correction: ✅ I need to hire a lawyer to draft my will.（起草遗嘱用lawyer即可）

common_errors.error: ❌ The lawyer general will make a statement.
common_errors.correction: ✅ The attorney general will make a statement.（司法部长固定用attorney general）

mini_test.question: 选择最通用的词：My ___ advised me not to speak to the press.
在美国，哪个词指'有代理权的律师'？
mini_test.explanation: 美国用attorney指有代理权的律师
